meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or characteristic of an incubator.
meanings.sent1: The incubatory environment provided the necessary warmth for the eggs to hatch.
meanings.sent2: The hospital had an incubatory unit for premature babies.
meanings.sent3: The scientist's incubatory experiment with the bacteria yielded interesting results.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an incubatory space for creative ideas to develop.
meanings.sent5: The incubatory glow of the heat lamp kept the chicks cozy and safe.

meanings.sent1: The hen's incubatory behavior ensured the eggs stayed warm.
meanings.sent2: The incubatory function of the device helped cultivate a bacteria culture.
meanings.sent3: The incubatory role of the mother bird was crucial for the survival of her offspring.
meanings.sent4: The garage served as an incubatory space for the inventor's new projects.
meanings.sent5: The incubatory heat of the compost pile aided in the decomposition process.

meanings.sent1: The incubatory heat of the nest kept the eggs at the right temperature.
meanings.sent2: The incubatory ability of the machine allowed for the growth of microorganisms.
meanings.sent3: The incubatory nature of the soil promoted the growth of seeds.
meanings.sent4: The incubatory warmth of the sun helped the seeds germinate.
meanings.sent5: The incubatory conditions in the lab supported the development of the embryos.
